Class HeapSorter<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>

java.lang.Object
  edu.csupomona.cs.cs241.proj1.HeapSorter<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the object contained in the array to be sorted
public class HeapSorter<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
extends java.lang.Object

This class's single function is to sort the passed array with a heapsort algorithm.

Author:
Satshabad

Method Summary
private  void heapify(E[] array)
          This internal method turns any given array into a heap, even if the array.
private  void siftDown(int node, int end, E[] array)
          This method takes the index of any node in a heap and moves the node toward the leaves until it is greater than both it's child nodes.
private  void siftUp(int node, E[] array)
          This method takes the index of any node in a heap and moves the node toward the root until it is less than both it's parent node.
 void sort(E[] array)
          Creates a heapSorter object solely to sort the given array.
private  void swap(E[] array, int j, int i)

sort

public void sort(E[] array)
Creates a heapSorter object solely to sort the given array.

Parameters:
array - of objects to be sorted

heapify

private void heapify(E[] array)
This internal method turns any given array into a heap, even if the array. has repeat elements

Parameters:
array - the array to be turned into a heap.

siftDown

private void siftDown(int node,
                      int end,
                      E[] array)
This method takes the index of any node in a heap and moves the node toward the leaves until it is greater than both it's child nodes. The heap is in array form.

Parameters:
node - the index of the node to be sifted down
end - the last leaf in the heap to be looked at
array - the array which contains the heap

siftUp

private void siftUp(int node,
                    E[] array)
This method takes the index of any node in a heap and moves the node toward the root until it is less than both it's parent node. The heap is in array form.

Parameters:
node - the index of the node to be sifted up
array - the array which contains the heap

swap

private void swap(E[] array,
                  int j,
                  int i)
This internal method swaps two elements in the given array.

Parameters:
array - the array containing the objects at the indices to be switched
j - the index of the first object
i - the index of the second object
